an3.57:1.1: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
an3.57:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:
an3.57:1.3: “I have heard, Master Gotama, that the ascetic Gotama says this:
an3.57:1.4: ‘Gifts should only be given to me, not to others.
an3.57:1.5: Gifts should only be given to my disciples, not to the disciples of others.
an3.57:1.6: Only what is given to me is very fruitful, not what is given to others.
an3.57:1.7: Only what is given to my disciples is very fruitful, not what is given to the disciples of others.’
an3.57:1.13: I trust that those who say this repeat what the Buddha has said, and do not misrepresent him with an untruth? Is their explanation in line with the teaching? Are there any legitimate grounds for rebuke and criticism?
an3.57:1.14: For we don’t want to misrepresent Master Gotama.”
an3.57:2.5: do not repeat what I have said. They misrepresent me with what is false and untrue.
an3.57:2.6: Anyone who prevents another from giving makes an obstacle and a barrier for three people.
an3.57:2.8: The giver is obstructed from making merit. The receiver is obstructed from getting what is offered. And they’ve already broken and damaged themselves.
an3.57:2.9: Anyone who prevents another from giving makes an obstacle and a barrier for these three people.
an3.57:3.1: Vaccha, this is what I say:
an3.57:3.2: ‘You even make merit by tipping out dish-washing water in a cesspool or a sump with living creatures in it, thinking,
an3.57:3.4: How much more then for human beings!
an3.57:3.5: However, I also say that a gift to an ethical person is more fruitful than one to an unethical person. They’ve given up five factors, and possess five factors.
an3.57:4.1: What are the five factors they’ve given up?
an3.57:4.2: Sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
an3.57:4.3: These are the five factors they’ve given up.
an3.57:5.1: What are the five factors they possess?
an3.57:5.2: The entire spectrum of an adept’s ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom.
an3.57:5.3: These are the five factors they possess.
an3.57:5.4: I say that a gift to anyone who has given up these five factors and possesses these five factors is very fruitful.
an3.57:6.1: Cows may be black or white,
an3.57:7.1: But when one is born among them,
an3.57:7.5: they yoke the load just to him,
an3.57:9.3: Firm in principle, accomplished in ethical conduct,
an3.57:10.1: they’ve given up birth and death.
an3.57:10.4: they’ve completed the task and are free of defilements.
an3.57:12.3: give their gifts to those outside,
an3.57:12.4: and don’t attend the peaceful ones.
an3.57:13.1: But those who do attend the peaceful ones—
an3.57:13.3: and whose faith in the Holy One
an3.57:14.1: they go to the realm of the gods,
an3.57:14.2: or are born here in a good family.
